column5: Any experience with a good restaurant in the Geraldton area. We fly out of Nakina but no good place to eat. Thanks

I own a drive to lodge east of Longlac. The only place I have tried eating at in Geraldton was a place I think was called Sizzler... not the chain place, just a family owned diner. It has been up for sale for a bit, so don't even know if its in business. One thing that I usually do, is order breakfast. They tend to do better cooking breakfast than dinners. Good luck, and have a good trip in 07! Greg

Hi Agate, I used to fish the Hearst area many years ago. I had a friend who had a cabin on Lake Privabiska-(spelling?). The past 6 or seven years we have been going to Quebec for the annual trip North. We primarily fish for walleyes with pike as a bonus catch. We are considering a second trip this year to Ontario. Please email or post information on your lodge. [email protected] Thank you
Sizzlers is a good bet - right on the main street through town. Look for the police station - it's across the street.
I will second that one. Not sure of the name but remebered it is across from the police station. Usually a pretty busy place and food has been good. No where else to go that I am aware of.

dave, last time in nakina there was a place on cordingly lake i think. Left at leuenbergers, but just before you get to nakina air service. don't know if it's still there or not. good food. do you have any experience with kap lake/awo? thinking about a trip there. ot
Since you are asking where I am and my site... check the signature line below. Greg Bolinski Agate Bay Lodgewww.agatebaylodge.com NPAA #944

Oletimer----The rest. you are refering to is closed. Yes I have used AWO --10 times with no.11 this June, and have marked maps of Kap and Melchett and Tester, are are boatable from Kap. E-mail [email protected] or call me 330-866-3363 days and I will be pleased to give you more info. One time dave (Dave Kean)
